Homework (due 0223)

Complete these for Friday, February 23. Show work that justifies your answers for full credit.

  1. Give parametric equation(s) for the line which satisfies the given conditions. Simplify if you wish, but it is not necessary.

    1. Goes through the point \((1,1)\) at \(t=1\) and the point \((3,5)\) at \(t=5\):

      \((x,y)=\left(1+\frac{2}{4}(t-1),1+\frac{4}{4}(t-1)\right).\)

    2. Goes through the point \((1,1)\) at \(t=-3\) and the point \((3,5)\) at \(t=0\):

      \((x,y)=\left(1+\frac{2}{3}(t+3),1+\frac{4}{3}(t+3)\right).\)

    3. Goes through the point \((-1,2)\) at \(t=3\) and the point \((3,-1)\) at \(t=10\):

      \((x,y)=\left(-1+\frac{4}{7}(t-3),2+\frac{-3}{7}(t-3)\right).\)

    4. Goes through the point \((1,1)\) at \(t=-2\) and the point \((1,5)\) at \(t=2\):

      \((x,y)=\left(1+\frac{0}{4}(t+2),1+\frac{4}{4}(t+2)\right).\)

    5. Goes through the point \((1,1)\) at \(t=0\) and the point \((5,1)\) at \(t=8\):

      \((x,y)=\left(1+\frac{4}{8}(t-0),1+\frac{0}{8}(t-0)\right).\)
